thread.title: Ostrich 5K run/walk in Wilmington benefits survivors of sexual abuse
thread.title_full: Ostrich 5K run/walk in Wilmington benefits survivors of sexual abuse

author: Staff Report
title: Ostrich 5K run/walk in Wilmington benefits survivors of sexual abuse
text: Ostrich 5K run/walk in Wilmington benefits survivors of sexual abuse SOAR (Survivors of Abuse in Recovery) is hosting the fundraiser on Sunday, Oct. 11 at Catherine Rooney's, Trolley Square, in Wilmington. Comment By Staff Report Posted Oct. 9, 2015 @ 2:17 pm Get those running shoes ready for SOAR’s sixth annual Ostrich 5K Run/Walk to raise awareness and funds to provide professional mental health services to child, teen, and adult victims of sexual abuse. SOAR stands for Survivors of Abuse in Recovery. The non-profit group is based in Wilmington. The group's Ostrich 5K will be held on Sunday, Oct. 11 at Catherine Rooney’s, Trolley Square, in Wilmington. Registration begins at 11 a.m., and the race/walk starts at noon. The event will be officiated by Races2Run with NOVA Timing Systems using IPCO chip timing. Top male and female finishers will each receive a $100 gift certificate to Delaware Running Company. Awards will be given for top three in 10-year age groups, from 13 and under through 70 and over. Prizes will also be awarded for the most creative team and the team that raises the most money. Top individual fundraiser will receive a $100 gift certificate to Krazy Kat’s restaurant. Race day "tek" t-shirts will be provided for the first 200 registered participants, ages 13 and up. All children 12 and under will receive snappy SOAR logo sunglasses. The post-race party features awards presentation, food, music, beer for ages 21 and over, and lots of fun for everyone. The fee until Oct. 9 is $20 per person. On Oct. 10 and on race day, the fee is $25. For children 12 and under, the fee is $10 until Oct. 9 or $15 after. To register individually or by team, go to either www.races2run.com/events/ostrich-5k OR www.survivorsofabuse.org/events . For more information, call Arlene Boles, SOAR development director, at (302) 655-3953, ext. 107 or email aboles@soarinc.com .
